div.l: Thys lang nyght there tydes me na reste
But yet na force / all shall be for the beste
For Iohn saide he / as eủer mote I thryue
Gyf that I may / the yonge wenche wole I swyue
Som esement has lawe y shapen vs

l.hi: For Iohn ther is a lawe that seyth thus
That gyf a man in a poynt be agreued
That in a nother he shall be releued

div.l: Oure corn is stolen / sothly it is na nay
And we haf had an ylle fit thys day
And syn I shall haue nan amendement
A gayn my losse / I wole haue esement
By goddis saule / it sal nan other be
This Iohn answerid Aleyn avise the
The Milner is a ꝑperilous man he saide
And if that he out of his sleep abraide
He myght vs don bothe a vilenye
Aleyn answerde / I counte hym nat worth worth a flye
And vp he ryste / and by the wenche he crepte
This wenche lay vpryght / and faste slepte
Tyl he so nygh was / er she myght espye
That it hadde ben / to late for to crye
And shortly for to seyn / they were a toon
Now pley Aleyn for I wole speke of Iohn
This Iohn lyth stille / a furlong wey or twoo
And to hym selfe / he maketh reuthe and woo
Allas quod he thys is a wikked Iape
Now may I seyn / that I am but an ape
Yet has myn felawe somwhat / for his harme
He hathe the Milner doughter in his Arme
He Auntred hym / and hath his nedes spedde
And I lye as a draffe sakke in my bedde
And whan this Iape is tolde a nother day
I shall byholden a daffe a Cokenay
I wil arise and auntre it be my fayth
Vnhardy is vnsely / thus men saith
And vp he roos / and softely he wente
Vn to the cradel / and in his hande it hente
And bare it softe / vn to his beddes feet
Sone aftir this / the wife here routyng leet
And gan a wake / and wente hire oute to pisse
